intro: Jonthlaspi, commonly known as the common whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, linear to oblanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Jonthlaspi is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats.
